intro: Echeandia coalcomanensis, commonly known as the Coalcoman River plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with yellow petals and a central disk. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its botanical features include narrow, lance-shaped leaves and a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
